node.category: What is the way things are?

node.surface: Intelligence services apparently enjoy indiscriminate liberties.

node.category: What kinds of liberties do intelligence services enjoy?

node.surface: No one can follow their activities in detail.

node.category: What implications does this secrecy have?

node.surface: Of course a certain level of secrecy is the basis for the work of intelligence services.
The unregulated work of the secret services, however, carries the danger of misuse of their authority.

node.category: How can we avoid the misuse of the authority of secret services?

node.surface: That's why intelligence services must be regulated in the framework of parliamentary oversight committees.
